intro: Eritrichium pectinatociliatum, commonly known as the silky eritrichium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale purple or white, with four petals arranged in a cross shape. Eritrichium pectinatociliatum is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
